extendedInfo.description: Mobile Energy Monitoring! View energy data sent from your efergy engage hub on your phone. Weâve included the same great widgets for you to check and reduce your use. Discover if youâve left something on, set a budget and get saving. No engage hub yet? No worries, try our built-in demo.This is the best way to track your home energy consumption on the go. Once you have installed the engage app you will have access to a range of features that allow you to monitor your energy consumption remotely.Notice:This app works only with the efergy engage hub. You must first register an account, set-up your hub and pair it with your transmitter at engage.efergy.com before you can see your energy usage on the smartphone app.Features:Your energy use:Takes into account your current real time usage level and whether you are under or over budget to rate your behaviour.Widget library:Collection of engage widgets, access each widget by selecting a tile on-screen.Real-time:Display real-time power use in kW, cost and kgCo2. Set an energy consumption alarm. There are four different widget styles to choose from.Budget:Show how much you have spent and what your estimated monthly spend will be. Set the budget target through the menu option.Cost so far:Shows you how much you have spent today, this month and since a user set date (through the menu option).Energy graph:The energy graph widget allows you to see your demand in kW along with your consumption over daily and monthly periods. Rotate your phone to change the level of detail shown on each graph. Landscape shows you the overall trend and portrait shows you a closer look at your data. Use the arrows to go backward and forward in time to view your consumption history.Social media:Use this to post your performance data to a social media site of your choice (Facebook, Twitter, Google+ and LinkedIn is available).Display:The display style will change to night mode at 9pm everyday, altering the appearance of the app. Options are available within Settings to disable this feature and choose a particular style. Login:Login using the details you registered when joining and setting up your hub at engage.efergy.com

reviews.title: Improved, but still needs some work
reviews.comment: I can\'t access any setting to make use of budget/history features. Using a flash up prompt to communicate this error is an extremely bad idea for such a long message
reviews.author: Trent Hewton

reviews.title: Almost there!
reviews.comment: I want to love this app and frankly it is absolutely amazing. The issue I face, however, is that its practically useless on a tablet (160 dpi.) This will be a 5 star rating if the display scaling is fixed! :)  Please fix this minor issue.  Downrated, get this sorted on tablets.
reviews.author: Christopher Williamson

reviews.title: So buggy it crawls
reviews.comment: So much potential, such a disappointment.  Hope they get their act together because this could be really useful.  Or better  yet, hope Nest does this product.
reviews.author: George Favaloro

reviews.title: Needs some work
reviews.comment: Great potential but needs some work. I already have the e2 meter and upgraded it with this hub. When I sync with my e2 the old values don\302\264t show up, so I lost my history. Needs the dual tariff like e2. And here in Portugal the tariff per Kwh is 0,1641 and in the settings I can\302\264t put value minor than 1.
reviews.author: Joao paulo marques

reviews.title: dop
reviews.comment: love the app...best of its kind!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Ok, but needs Android widgets
reviews.comment: There are no wallpaper / home screen widgets. This feature would allow you to see real time data without having to enter the app. Please consider this request.
reviews.author: Richard Hemsley

reviews.title: Works as expected
reviews.comment: Engage hub is easy to configure if you already have the transmitter in service.   I have some minor complaints about the Android interface, for example exiting (and shutting down) the app could be more intuitive- it took me a while to figure out.   Would love to see a tablet version, hopefully with the same level of detail in the graph section as seen in the web interface.
reviews.author: Jon Kiphart

reviews.title: OK as a first attempt.
reviews.comment: Unintuitive UI, designers need to read up on android Holo in the developers site. Needs a widget too. Only just set up yet usage history graph has loads of random data in it.
reviews.author: Tim Morley

reviews.title: No good in tablets
reviews.comment: Screen orientation and scale don\'t work
reviews.author: Debbie Richards

reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
reviews.comment: Easy enough to work out.  Facebook doesn\'t want to integrate but G+ is fine. An hourly updating widget would be good.
reviews.author: Joshua Ferguson

reviews.title: Great app
reviews.comment: Nice work here. I can check my usage even when I\'m not home....I love things on the go.
reviews.author: Pawel Sobala

reviews.title: Jury out
reviews.comment: Still no dual tariffs yet. A must.
reviews.author: colum cusack

reviews.comment: Overall very pleased. Still needs a few add ons though. Dual zone tariffs, data export etc...  Waiting for the new upgrade ...
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good start
reviews.comment: Great App.   However was an oversight not to release without dual tariff, surely someone thought about Economy 7 users?
reviews.author: Julian Sims

reviews.title: Helpful graphs
reviews.comment: The info is clear, the app is reliable and the images are cool. Couldn\'t ask for more, great!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Needs polishing
reviews.comment: The UI is clunky and the chart isn\'t clear.   I\'m not sure why it needs to run in the background.
reviews.author: Thiago Figueir\303\263
